net.nexttext.behaviour.standard
Class Colorize

java.lang.Object
  net.nexttext.behaviour.AbstractAction
      net.nexttext.behaviour.standard.Colorize
All Implemented Interfaces:
Action
public class Colorize
extends AbstractAction

Fades the color of an object to a new color over time.

Nested Class Summary
 
Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface net.nexttext.behaviour.Action

Constructor Detail

Colorize

public Colorize(Color color,
                float speed)
The Colorize action will only influence the fill colour.

This constructor is kept for code consistency with code that was using Colorize prior to the implementation of the stroke property.

Parameters:
color - The target color
speed - The speed factor at which the colorization is applied

Colorize

public Colorize(Color color,
                float speed,
                boolean fill,
                boolean stroke)
The Colorize action is applied to the given glyph colour component (i.e. the stroke and/or the fill)

Parameters:
color - The target color
speed - The speed factor at which the colorization is applied
fill - Indicates if the action has to be processed on the fill
stroke - Indicates if the action has to be processed on the stroke

Colorize

public Colorize(Color colorFill,
                float speedFill,
                Color colorStroke,
                float speedStroke)
The Colorize action is applied to the fill and the stroke colours, according to the given values.

Parameters:
colorFill - The target color of the fill
speedFill - The colorization speed for the fill
colorStroke - The target color of the stroke
speedStroke - The colorization speed for the stroke

Colorize

public Colorize(int r,
                int g,
                int b,
                float speed)
Creates a Colorize which changes the glyphs color over time. The colorization is only applied to the glyphs fill property. Specify red, green and blue color values.

Parameters:
r - the red value of the color, an integer from 0 to 255
g - the green value of the color, an integer from 0 to 255
b - the blue color value of the color, an integer from 0 to 255
speed - The speed factor at which the colorization is applied

Colorize

public Colorize(int color,
                float speed)
Creates a Colorize which changes the glyphs color over time. The colorization is only applied to the glyphs fill property. Specify a hexadecimal color value with 6 numbers (24 bits).

Parameters:
color - hexadecimal argb color value. eg. 0xFF3421 is a light green (the format is RRGGBB).
speed - The speed factor at which the colorization is applied

Colorize

public Colorize(int color,
                int alpha,
                float speed)
Creates a Colorize which changes the glyphs color over time. The colorization is only applied to the glyphs fill property. Specify a hexadecimal color value with 6 numbers (24 bits).

Parameters:
color - hexadecimal rgb color value. eg. 0xFF3421 is a light green (the format is RRGGBB).
speed - The speed factor at which the colorization is applied

Colorize

public Colorize(int r,
                int g,
                int b,
                int alpha,
                float speed)
Creates a Colorize which changes the glyphs color over time. The colorization is only applied to the glyphs fill property. Specify red, green and blue color values as well as an alpha value.

Parameters:
r - the red value of the color, an integer from 0 to 255
g - the green value of the color, an integer from 0 to 255
b - the blue color value of the color, an integer from 0 to 255
alpha - the alpha or transparency of the color, an integer from 0 to 255
speed - The speed factor at which the colorization is applied

Colorize

public Colorize(int r,
                int g,
                int b,
                float speed,
                boolean fill,
                boolean stroke)
Creates a Colorize which changes the glyphs color over time. Colorization can be applied to the glyph's fill and stroke properties. Specify red, green and blue color values.

Parameters:
r - the red value of the color, an integer from 0 to 255
g - the green value of the color, an integer from 0 to 255
b - the blue color value of the color, an integer from 0 to 255
speed - The speed factor at which the colorization is applied
fill - Indicates if the action has to be processed on the fill
stroke - Indicates if the action has to be processed on the stroke

Colorize

public Colorize(int r,
                int g,
                int b,
                int alpha,
                float speed,
                boolean fill,
                boolean stroke)
Creates a Colorize which changes the glyphs color over time. Colorization can be applied to the glyphs fill and stroke properties. Specify red, green and blue color values as well as an alpha value.

Parameters:
r - the red value of the color, an integer from 0 to 255
g - the green value of the color, an integer from 0 to 255
b - the blue color value of the color, an integer from 0 to 255
alpha - the alpha or transparency of the color, an integer from 0 to 255
speed - The speed factor at which the colorization is applied
fill - Indicates if the action has to be processed on the fill
stroke - Indicates if the action has to be processed on the stroke

Colorize

public Colorize(int color,
                float speed,
                boolean fill,
                boolean stroke)
Creates a Colorize which changes the glyphs color over time. Colorization can be applied to the glyph's fill and stroke properties. Specify a hexadecimal color value. There is no transparency.

Parameters:
color - hexadecimal rgb color value. eg. 0xFF3421 is a light green (the format is RRGGBB).
speed - The speed factor at which the colorization is applied
fill - Indicates if the action has to be processed on the fill
stroke - Indicates if the action has to be processed on the stroke

Colorize

public Colorize(int color,
                int alpha,
                float speed,
                boolean fill,
                boolean stroke)
Creates a Colorize which changes the glyphs color over time. Colorization can be applied to the glyph's fill and stroke properties. Specify a hexadecimal color value. There is no transparency.

Parameters:
color - hexadecimal rgb color value. eg. 0xFF3421 is a light green (the format is RRGGBB).
alpha - transparency value, the range is from 0 to 255
speed - The speed factor at which the colorization is applied
fill - Indicates if the action has to be processed on the fill
stroke - Indicates if the action has to be processed on the stroke

Colorize

public Colorize(int rFill,
                int gFill,
                int bFill,
                float speedFill,
                int rStroke,
                int gStroke,
                int bStroke,
                float speedStroke)
The Colorize action is applied to the fill and the stroke colours, according to the given values.

Parameters:
rFill - red color value for fill (0 to 255)
gFill - green color value for fill (0 to 255)
bFill - blue color value for fill (0 to 255)
speedFill - The colorization speed for the fill
rStroke - red color value for stroke (0 to 255)
gStroke - green color value for stroke (0 to 255)
bStroke - blue color value for stroke (0 to 255)
speedStroke - The colorization speed for the stroke

Colorize

public Colorize(int rFill,
                int gFill,
                int bFill,
                int alphaFill,
                float speedFill,
                int rStroke,
                int gStroke,
                int bStroke,
                int alphaStroke,
                float speedStroke)
The Colorize action is applied to the fill and the stroke colours, according to the given values.

Parameters:
rFill - red color value for fill (0 to 255)
gFill - green color value for fill (0 to 255)
bFill - blue color value for fill (0 to 255)
alphaFill - transparency for the fill (0 to 255)
speedFill - The colorization speed for the fill
rStroke - red color value for stroke (0 to 255)
gStroke - green color value for stroke (0 to 255)
bStroke - blue color value for stroke (0 to 255)
alphaStroke - transparency for the stroke (0 to 255)
speedStroke - The colorization speed for the stroke

Colorize

public Colorize(int colorFill,
                float speedFill,
                int colorStroke,
                float speedStroke)
The Colorize action is applied to the fill and the stroke colours, according to the given values.

Parameters:
colorFill - hexadecimal rgb color value. eg. 0xFF3421 is a light green (the format is RRGGBB).
speedFill - The colorization speed for the fill
colorStroke - hexadecimal rgb color value. eg. 0xFF3421 is a light green (the format is RRGGBB).
speedStroke - The colorization speed for the stroke

Colorize

public Colorize(int colorFill,
                int alphaFill,
                float speedFill,
                int colorStroke,
                int alphaStroke,
                float speedStroke)
The Colorize action is applied to the fill and the stroke colours, according to the given values.

Parameters:
colorFill - hexadecimal rgb color value. eg. 0xFF3421 is a light green (the format is RRGGBB).
alphaFill - transparency for the fill (0 to 255)
speedFill - The colorization speed for the fill
colorStroke - hexadecimal rgb color value. eg. 0xFF3421 is a light green (the format is RRGGBB).
alphaStroke - transparency for the stroke (0 to 255)
speedStroke - The colorization speed for the stroke
Method Detail

behave

public Action.ActionResult behave(TextObject to)
Description copied from class: AbstractAction
Default behave method for single objects.

This method does nothing; it should be overriden by subclasses if they wish to support actions on single objects.

Trying to call this method on an Action which doesn't override it will throw an UnsupportedActionException.

Specified by:
behave in interface Action
Overrides:
behave in class AbstractAction

                int g,
                int b,
                float speed)

Parameters:
r - red color value for fill (0 to 255)
g - green color value for fill (0 to 255)
b - blue color value for fill (0 to 255)

set

public void set(int r,
                int g,
                int b,
                float speed,
                boolean fill,
                boolean stroke)
Set function which changes the color and speed of the fill or stroke, or both.

Parameters:
r - red color value (0 to 255)
g - green color value (0 to 255)
b - blue color value (0 to 255)
speed - speed at which the color changes
fill - determines whether the fill changes color
stroke - determines whether the stroke changes color

set

                int g,
                int b,
                int alpha,
                float speed,
                boolean fill,
                boolean stroke)

Parameters:
r - red color value (0 to 255)
g - green color value (0 to 255)
b - blue color value (0 to 255)
alpha - transparency value (0 to 255)
speed - speed at which the color changes
fill - determines whether the fill changes color
stroke - determines whether the stroke changes color

                float speed,
                boolean fill,

public void set(int rFill,
                int gFill,
                int bFill,
                float fillSpeed,
                int rStroke,
                int gStroke,
                int bStroke,
                float strokeSpeed)
Change the color and speed of the Colorize for both stroke and fill.

Parameters:
rFill - red color value for fill (0 to 255)
gFill - green color value for fill (0 to 255)
bFill - blue color value for fill (0 to 255)
speedFill - The colorization speed for the fill
rStroke - red color value for stroke (0 to 255)
gStroke - green color value for stroke (0 to 255)
bStroke - blue color value for stroke (0 to 255)
speedStroke - The colorization speed for the stroke

alphaStroke - transparency for the stroke (0 to 255)
